template.name: Template UserGateUTM_My
template.description:
orig: https://github.com/AndAndr
Modified template for SNMP Usergate UTM Monitoring Different discovery rules for 32 and 64 bit SNMP values
Tested on Usegate D500, Usergate VE2000 FW: 6.1.9
1. Enable + config SNMP on UTM 2. Map template + run autodiscovery 3. Disable elements for all interfaces in down oper state
Contact: telegram @Magicpad

trigger.name: CPU load is too high!

item.name: Used space on log disk percentage

trigger.name: Check used space on log disk
Memory utilization is too high!
SNMPTrap: Unknown event on {HOST.NAME}

SNMPTrap: Core crushing on {HOST.NAME}
SNMPTrap: Default gateway IP changed on {HOST.NAME}
SNMPTrap: High CPU usage notification on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: The number of active current users

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Incoming discarded unknown protocol packets
Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Last change
item_prototype.description: Значение sysUpTime на момент перехода интерфейса в его текущее рабочее состояние.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Interface MTU size
item_prototype.description: Размер самой большой дейтаграммы, которая может быть отправлена/получена по интерфейсу, указывается в октетах.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on interface {#SNMPVALUE}
Ouput packets queue for {#SNMPVALUE} is not empty

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Interface Speed
item_prototype.description:
Because of Gauge32 data size limitations (snmp shows value 1895825408), constantly replacing 10Gbps to 1 Gbps value
4294967295 is max value in Gauge32
10 Gpbs - 4294967295 - 4294967295 = 1895825408, breaking all triggers

trigger_prototype.name: Incoming use on interface {#SNMPVALUE} exceed 80% for the last 5 minutes
Operational status of interface {#SNMPVALUE} is DOWN!
Outgoing use on interface {#SNMPVALUE} exceed 80% for the last 5 minutes

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Incoming traffic 2
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received on the interface, 64-bit version of ifInOctets

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Incoming unicast packets 2
item_prototype.description: This object is a 64-bit version of ifInUcastPkts

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Outgoing traffic 2
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received on the interface, 64-bit version of ifOutOctets

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Outgoing unicast packets 2
item_prototype.description: This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutUcastPkts
